Package neureka.optimization

Interface Optimizer<V>

  • Type Parameters:
    V - The value type parameter of the tensors processed by this optimizer.
    All Superinterfaces:
    Component<Tsr<V>>, Optimization<V>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ADAM, SGD
    public interface Optimizer<V>
extends Component<Tsr<V>>, Optimization<V>
    Optimizers are tensor components which implement the Optimization (functional) interface applying various optimization algorithms to the gradients of tensors.
    A simple usage example would be the following: 
    
      Optimizer o = new SGD(0.01); // 0.01 learning rate
      Tsr<Float> w = Tsr.of(0f);
      w.set(o);

    If you want to create custom Optimizer implementations in a functional style take a look at the following example: 
    
      Optimizer.of( t -> {
          Tsr<?> gradient = t.getGradient();
          // ... apply algorithm ...
      })
    Or consider using the factory method below to process gradients directly: 
    
      Optimizer.ofGradient( gradient -> {
          // ... apply algorithm ...
      })

    • Method Detail

      • of

        static <T> Optimizer<T> of​(Optimization<T> o)
        Type Parameters:
        T - The value type parameter of the tensors processed by this optimizer.
        Parameters:
        o - The Optimization lambda which receives a tensor for optimization.
        Returns:
        An Optimizer which will process any passed tensor directly (see ofGradient(Optimization) which processes gradients).

      • ofGradient

        static <T> Optimizer<T> ofGradient​(Optimization<T> o)
        Type Parameters:
        T - The value type parameter of the tensors processed by this optimizer.
        Parameters:
        o - The Optimization lambda which receives the gradient of a tensor for optimization.
        Returns:
        An Optimizer which will process the gradient of any passed tensor (see of(Optimization) which processes tensors directly).
